35.heading: Fathers.
35.title: "Casotota"
35.author: argumento de Yolanda Vargas Dulch√© ; dibujo de Sixto Valencia Burgos
notes: SUMMARY: Carlos's father takes him to see his mansion and meet his grandmother. He tells Carlos that he would like him to leave his poverty and move in, but Carlos refuses to leave his mother.

36.heading: Fathers.
36.title: "Chapuz√≥n"
36.author: Yolanda Vargas Dulc√©
notes: SUMMARY: Since Ricardo wants to be part of the gang the other boys arrange an initiation. First Ricardo has to carry each of them on his back like a horse. Then he has to let them throw him in the school's rooftop cistern. This is accomplished, but Ricardo can't get himself out of the cistern, sinks to the bottom, and drowns. Carlos pulls him out, and he seems dead, but he's not, quite. The teacher hears the commotion, takes Ricardo to the school doctor, and covers for the boys with the administration. At home Ricardo's mother insists that they move him to a new school. In a private talk with his father Ricardo explains everything, says he deserved his punishment, and wants to stay in the public school. The father understands because he wasn't always rich, and makes up a story to calm his wife. Things go better at school among the boys, and after a few days Ricardo dismisses his chauffeur so he can play baseball in an alley. Since it's a dirty place Ricardo takes his shoes off, and Mem√≠n guards them. Some bigger boys come along and want to use the area for their own game, and a fistfight starts. During the confusion a thief picks up Ricardo's shoes.

37.heading: Fathers.
37.title: "Cheer Up, Dad. This Year Has to be Better"
37.author: Young & Drake.
notes: Summary: Dagwood's last score card from last year falls out of his golf bag as he gets ready for the new season.

38.heading: Fathers.
38.title: "The Child is Father to...?"
38.author: Shooter, Perez, Layton & Michelinie, plot ; David Michilinie, writer ; George Perez and Dan Green, art

39.heading: Fathers.
39.title: "El Chisme"
39.author: argumento de Yolanda Vargas Dulc√©
notes: SUMMARY: Mem√≠n, Ricardito and Carlangas find their friend in the carpentry shop, drinking liquor. Ernestillo says that if his father can see his wife and talk to her when he's drunk, he wants to do it too and talk to his mother. When the boys take the bottle from him, Ernestillo attacks with a hammer and manages to knock himself out. His friends put him in his bed, and return to school. The teacher wants to know what they found, and they say Ernestillo wasn't home. The teacher doesn't believe them, and questions them until he gets the truth. The teacher rushes to the carpentry shop, sees Ernestillo unconscious, and calls an ambulance. The boys wait at the hospital while the teacher looks for Mr. Vargas, the missing father of Ernestillo. The news that his son is in the Red Cross hospital shocks Mr. Vargas, and hearing that Ernestillo was trying to see his mother fills him with shame. In the hospital, Ernestillo recovers. The teacher brings Mr. Vargas to his son, and he begs his son's forgiveness.

54.heading: Fathers.
54.title: "Detenido!"
54.author: argumento de Yolanda Vargas Dulch√© ; dibujo, Sixto Valencia
notes: SUMMARY: Mem√≠n tells his disapproving mother, Eufrosina, the story of how the boys searched the cabarets looking for Carlos's mother. Ernesto's father is also angry, blames himself, and says he's going to start drinking again. Both parents are sympathetic once they've heard the whole story, however. Ricardo's mother is frantic and fainting, and his father beats him savagely with his belt, but after an explanation the father is proud of his son. He asks Ricardo not to tell his mother about the beating, and Ricardo agrees. Mem√≠n's mother sends him out for milk, and he sees pictures of Carlos and his mother in the newspaper. Carlos has been arrested for murder, and sent to the house of correction. Everyone's first thought is that Ricardo's father might be able to help Carlos, but that seems not to be the case. The boys decide to ask their teacher.

71.heading: Fathers.
71.title: "Fantasma"
71.author: argumento: Yolanda Vargas Dulch√© ; dibujo, Sixto Valencia B
notes: SUMMARY: Mem√≠n explores the reform school where Carlangas is being held until he finds the right solitary confinement cell. Carlos is happy to hear that his mother is still alive, and tells Mem√≠n how the warden has whipped him and locked him up for a crime he didn't commit. Mem√≠n is noticed and taken to the warden, and the warden gets ready to whip Mem√≠n. Mem√≠n jumps out the window and hides on the school grounds. He hears two women talking about a ghost sighting around the school, and with a sheet and some stilts he scares the guards enough to make his escape. Meanwhile Elisa, the nurse who knows Carlos is innocent, visits Carlos's mother at the Red Cross hospital and brings her up to date on her son's situation. Carlos's mother brings up the fact that Carlos's father is rich and powerful. Since he has never taken the trouble to even ask about his son, she doesn't want to go to him for help.

83.heading: Fathers.

83.author: by Shizuru Seino ; translator, Aya Matsunaga ; English adaptation, Kelly Sue DeConnick.
notes: "Originally published as "Power!"
First published in Japan by Kodansha, Ltd., Tokyo, 2000.

Summary (from OCLC): Kyo Aizawa is a teenage girl who just wants to live a normal teenage life, but her father, who used to be a basketball player and wanted to make it to the NBA, is now determined to live his dreams through his daughter. She finds out that her father registered her as a boy and cooked up a scheme so that she would play on the boys basketball team and become the basketball player he always wanted to be.

86.title: Good-bye Millions
86.author: Michael J
notes: (Riverdale High ; 10)
Summary: When it appears that her father's business may collapse, Veronica Lodge is forced to economize and get a job.

87.heading: Fathers.
87.title: "Good Ol' Chip, He's a Born Husband"
87.author: Dik Browne
87.appears_in: p. 120 in Battered Husbands (Redondo Beach, CA : H. Gregory Associates, 1991).
notes: Summary: Chip asks Lois why Dad's money is both of theirs, but her money is hers alone; Hi overhears.

88.heading: Fathers.
88.title: "El Gordo Juan Balas"
88.author: [No author]
88.series: Pedro Balas) 10 p. in Pedro Balas, no. 15
notes: Two-part story about the death of Pedro Balas's father.

89.heading: Fathers.
89.title: "Gratis" ; p. 46 in Condorito Gigante, no. 418
89.author: [No author]
notes: SUMMARY: A new father comes to registrar Condorito to register the birth of a son; after he finds out registration is free he decides to register two more, since they had triplets.

90.heading: Fathers.
90.title: "The Graveyard of Space"
90.author: art: George Appel? 8 p
notes: Villain is Dagara; introduction of Ted and his father.
Data from Lou Mougin via the Grand Comics Database Project.

91.heading: Fathers.
91.title: "Grinding His Teeth a Lot Lately"
91.author: by Kevin Fagan.
notes: Summary: Dad takes his false teeth out and grinds them together on a table, Norman is worried.

92.heading: Fathers.
92.title: "He Stood on a Chair"
92.author: [No author]
92.series: Fat Freddy's Cat) 1/2 p. in The Adventures of Fat Freddy's Cat, no. 2
notes: By Gilbert Shelton and Dave Sheridan.
His mother was a Great Dane, and his father was a Chihuahua.

93.heading: Fathers.
93.title: "He Was Amazed at My Ability to Hit Those Water Targets Every Time!"
93.author: Armstrong.
notes: Summary: A son admires his dad's golf trophy, which was actually given to him as a gag. "You got the highest score, dad!"

94.heading: Fathers.
94.title: "He Won't Be Happy Until He Hacks His Rotted Lungs Out Onto Sunday Dinner"
94.author: by Ray Billingsley.
notes: Summary: Curtis is trying to get Dad to stop smoking.

95.heading: Fathers.
95.title: Heavy Snow : My Father's Disappearance into Alzheimer's
95.author: John Haugse.
notes: Autobiographical.

96.heading: Fathers.
96.title: "Her Father is a Pediatrician and He Still Treats Her Like a Child"
96.author: by Kate Osann.

97.heading: Fathers.
97.title: "Here's to You Pop, Thanks for Nothing!"
97.author: Wilson & Nolan.
notes: Summary: Dana drinks vodka in the ladies' room before her father's funeral.

98.heading: Fathers.
98.title: "He's Estimating How Many More Saturdays He's Got Off Before He Has To Start Mowing The Lawn Again"
98.author: Armstrong.
notes: Summary: Marvin and a bird sit in the sandbox watching Marvin's dad inspect the lawn.

99.heading: Fathers.
99.title: "He's Not Quite That Bad, Martha"
99.author: Bill Freyse.
notes: Summary: The lawn chair business is working, and Amos gives Martha $15. The last time Martha got money from Amos was when she took the blame for his sitting on her father's ukulele.

100.heading: Fathers.
100.title: "Hey, Dad! You Forgot to Turn Off the Grass Before We Left!"
100.author: Ketcham.
notes: Summary: The family returns from a trip to a thriving lawn.

101.heading: Fathers.
101.title: "His Father's Footsteps!" 5 p. in Black Magic, no. 4
101.author: [No author]
notes: "Even at a tender age anyone could see that Freddie was going to outdo his father, and his old man was the best hangman in the business!"

102.heading: Fathers.
102.title: "His Old Man's the Dog Warden"
102.author: Lewis.
notes: Summary: Kordiak's dad told him to either get a haircut or a dog license; we see a long-haired youth leaving in the back of a dog pound truck.

103.heading: Fathers.
103.title: "Honor Thy Father"
103.author: David Michelinie, writer ; John Byrne and Klaus Janson, artists

104.heading: Fathers.
104.title: "The Hopgig Drug Smugglers"
104.author: art: George Appel
104.appears_in: 8 p. in Planet Comics, no. 24 (May 1943) ; reprinted in Planet Comics, no. 65 (1951).
notes: Villains Zela and her father introduced.
Data from Lou Mougin via the Grand Comics Database Project.

105.heading: Fathers.
105.title: "Hungry for Love"
105.author: [No author]
105.series: Jughead) 5 p. in Jughead with Archie Digest Magazine, no. 131
notes: SUMMARY: Jughead's date's dad sells hamburgers.

106.heading: Fathers.
106.title: "I Bet You're Spoiling Her Like Crazy!"
106.author: Lynn.
106.series: For Better or For Worse, Nov. 4, 1998
notes: Summary: Elly's dad tells her about Dixie, the Sheltie that has come to live with him.

107.heading: Fathers.
107.title: "I Don't Want You Riding Your Bike After Dark!"
107.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Chuck didn't tell Abbey where he was going, and now she has to pick him up. Chuck wants to wait and talk to his dad.

108.heading: Fathers.
108.title: "I Have a White One with Lace You Can Borrow"
108.author: by Kathryn LeMieux.
notes: Summary: Dad can't find the pink slip for the car.

109.heading: Fathers.
109.title: "I Haven't Seen a Tree Since We Left the Sushi Palace"
109.author: Bill Hinds.
notes: Summary: Dawn's dad explores for restaurants when they go to tournaments, and now it looks like they might be late for the game.

110.heading: Fathers.
110.title: "I Know Why Dad Got Me That Bike! He's Trying to Bump Me Off"
110.author: by Bill Watterson.

111.heading: Fathers.
111.title: "I Must Know What Happened To My Father"
111.author: Westermann
111.appears_in: p. 37 in Cartoon Parade, v. 7, no. 68 (Jan. 1973).
notes: Summary: The Spacemasters have been giving Dr. Sam fortunes in gold for years, but this was a chance to catch one of them and ask about his missing father.

112.heading: Fathers.
112.title: "I Ought to Be a Pro and Give Lessons!"
112.author: by Dudley Fisher
112.appears_in: reproduced on p. 81 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Myrtle's pop gives her a golf lesson, and is impressed at the results.

113.heading: Fathers.
113.title: "I Suppose I'd Better Look In On Dad"
113.author: [No author]
113.series: Bart Brimston) 1/2 p. in The Dandy, no. 3062

114.heading: Fathers.
114.title: "I Think Dad Needs that Bottle More Than Me!"
114.author: Armstrong.
notes: Summary: Jeff has his dream hole-in-one interrupted because it's his turn to get up with Marvin.

115.heading: Fathers.
115.title: "I Think We Should Enlarge the Doggie Door"
115.author: by Kevin Fagan.
notes: Summary: Dad's been hit on the head and thinks he's a dog.

116.heading: Fathers.
116.title: "I Was Looking for Blueberries and He Just Showed Up!"
116.author: by Jack Elrod.
notes: Summary: Joseph tells his dad how Andy chased the wolves, and how he bandaged Andy.

117.heading: Fathers.
117.title: "I Won't Let My Son Have a Criminal for a Father"
117.author: Stan Lee & Larry Lieber.
notes: Summary: The Owl's wife says she's getting a divorce. She calls him Leland.

118.heading: Fathers.
118.title: "If I Ever Find You You'll Need Two Nurses to Hold You Up"
118.author: Ray Helle.
notes: Summary: Dad didn't fall when he went skating, but he needed a girl on each arm to hold him up.

119.heading: Fathers.
119.title: "If We Use Teamwork and Pull Together we'll Get Somewhere"
119.author: Ray Helle.
notes: Summary: The rest of the family gets together and drags Dad to a movie called South of Tutti Frutti.

120.heading: Fathers.
120.title: "If You're My Friend, You Should Accept My Messy Room"
120.author: Greg.
notes: Summary: Luann talks with her dad about friendship.

121.heading: Fathers.
121.title: "I'll be Applying Next Fall. Harvard's My First Choice"
121.author: Amend.
notes: Summary: Peter is being interviewed by Denise's father.

122.heading: Fathers.
122.title: "I'll Just Have To Go With A 3-Wood and Hope The Wind Doesn't Get Too Strong"
122.author: Mel Keefer, Jordan Lansky
122.appears_in: reproduced on p. 117 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: The broken driver was made by Sandy's dad, and he wouldn't have confidence in a borrowed one.

123.heading: Fathers.
123.title: "I'll Never Be a Rich Rapper or NBA Star Because I Have a Father Who Stuck Around!"
123.author: by Steve Watkins.
notes: Summary: Malik is suing his father.

124.heading: Fathers.
124.title: "I'm Calling Oprah About You, Dad!"
124.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Dad cooperates with the anti-smoking campaign and gives Curtis his cigarette pack to put in the garbage, but it's an empty pack.

125.heading: Fathers.
125.title: "I'm Feelin' a Little Guilty about Telling Kids that Wolverine's My Real Dad"
125.author: by Steve Watkins.

126.heading: Fathers.
126.title: "I'm Glib and I Like to Fib"
126.author: Armstrong.
notes: Summary: Chad's already qualified to run his dad's car dealership when he grows up.

127.heading: Fathers.
127.title: "I'm Going To Grow My Own Set Of Teeth"
127.author: Armstrong.
notes: Summary: Marvin's dad asks why the glass of water next to the bed.
Key word: False teeth.

128.heading: Fathers.
128.title: "I'm in a Hurry Today"
128.author: [No author]
128.series: Chuck White) p. 3-8 in Treasure Chest of Fun & Facts, v. 3, no. 13
notes: Begins: Chuck's father is home from the hospital and after school Chuck hurries homeward."
"To be continued."

129.heading: Fathers.
129.title: "I'm Not That Strange, Am I?"
129.author: A
notes: Summary: A father tells a child not to pat strange dogs, and Fred is annoyed.

130.heading: Fathers.
130.title: "In His Father's Crimson Footsteps" 8 p. in Crime Must Pay the Penalty, no. 26
130.author: [No author]

131.heading: Fathers.
131.title: In the Shadows of Their Fathers
131.author: writers, Thomas Andrews, Scott Allie ; artists, Adriana Melo, Joe Corroney, Michel LaCombe ; colorist, Michael Atiyeh ; letterer, Michael David Thomas.
notes: 1 v. : col. ill. ; 26 cm.
(Star Wars Empire ; v. 6)
"This volume collects issues #31, 29-30, 32-34 of the comic-book series Star Wars: Empire".
"These stories take place approximately eight months after the events in Star Wars: A New Hope".

Summary (from OCLC): When Luke and Leia travel to Jabiim to recuit allies for the Rebellion, they set into motion events that will ignite one man's betrayal of his people, set rebels against each other, and draw the attention of Darth Vader. And, Luke confronts the legacy of the Jedi father he never knew.

132.heading: Fathers.
132.title: "Information from his Mother"
132.author: Wilson and DiPreta.
notes: Key words: Birthdays, construction jobs, fathers.

133.heading: Fathers.
133.title: "Is Anybody Going to Eat the Last Bay-Scented Swordfish?"
133.author: by Robb Armstrong.
notes: Summary: Joe is upset because his dad has stolen the show at the simple burgers and hot dogs cookout he'd planned.

134.heading: Fathers.
134.title: "Is There No Man For Me?" 5 p. in My Own Romance, no. 73
134.author: [No author]
notes: SUMMARY: Janet resents having to get a part-time job when her father is laid off, but she finds romance in the shoe store.

135.heading: Fathers.
135.title: "Is This Dog the Reason You've Been Spending So Much Time out Here?"
135.author: by Jack Elrod.
notes: Summary: Joseph's dad finds Andy.

136.heading: Fathers.
136.title: "It Calls for Too Much Exertion"
136.author: Neg Cochran.
notes: (When You'd Love To Live Forever)
Summary: There's too much snow for Pa and Grandpa to deal with, Ma's going to call a neighbor boy, and the men settle in to smoke and read the paper.

137.heading: Fathers.
137.title: "It Came with the Desk"
137.author: Truxaw.
notes: Summary: The picture on Laura's desk isn't her father; she already knows what her family looks like.

138.heading: Fathers.
138.title: "It Happened Yesterday"
138.author: art: Lee Elias ; script: John Starr
notes: Introduction and origin of Firehair (Princess Smith; renamed Lynn Cabot in issue #24); introduction of J. B. Smith (her father, who dies but is renamed John Cabot in issue #24); introduction of villains Fingers & Blackie ; introduction of Little Ax and Chief Tehama.
Data from Lou Mougin via The Grand Comics Database Project.

139.heading: Fathers.
139.title: "It Was That Rankin Fellow"
139.author: [No author]
139.series: Chuck White) p. 3-8 in Treasure Chest of Fun & Facts, v. 3, no. 12
notes: Begins: "Chuck's father has been injured and Chuck has rushed home from New York to the hospital. Chuck's father tells him of the accident."

140.heading: Fathers.
140.title: "It's a Cookbook with Pictures"
140.author: Dik Browne.
notes: Summary: Honi is amazed to see her illiterate father engrossed in a book.

141.heading: Fathers.
141.title: "It's Easier for You, Dad!"
141.author: by Kevin Fagan.
notes: Summary: Dad's lecturing his sons about dental hygiene, and brushing after every meal.
Key words: False teeth, toothbrushes, restaurants.

142.heading: Fathers.
142.title: "It's Just Grass"
142.author: Mac ; created by Greg Howard.
notes: Summary: How come Dad's comparing lawns with the neighbors?

143.heading: Fathers.
143.title: "It's Taking Less Time for her to Train Me Than I Thought It Would"
143.author: Lynn.
143.series: For Better or For Worse, Nov. 7, 1998
notes: Summary: Ellie's dad's new dog, Dixie, is keeping him company.

144.heading: Fathers.
144.title: "I've Managed to Raise it Every Week So Far, Haven't I?"
144.author: Hayes.
notes: Summary: Chips asks dad for a raise.

145.heading: Fathers.
145.title: "I've Transgressed and You're Wearing My Father's Honeymoon Pajamas!"
145.author: by Kevin McCormick.
